doc.after: Skanderbeg's memory has been engraved in many museums, such as the Skanderbeg Museum next to KrujÃ« Castle. Many monuments are dedicated to his memory in the Albanian cities of Tirana (in Skanderbeg Square by Odhise Paskali),(in and outside Skanderbeg Museum by Janaq PaÃ§o) KrujÃ«, and Peshkopi. A palace in Rome in which Skanderbeg resided during his 1466â67 visits to the Vatican is still called Palazzo Skanderbeg and currently houses the Italian museum of pasta:[166] the palace is located between the Fontana di Trevi and the Quirinal Palace. Also in Rome, a statue is dedicated to the Albanian hero in Piazza Albania. Monuments or statues of Skanderbeg have also been erected in the cities of Skopje and Debar, in the Republic of Macedonia; Pristina, in Kosovo; Geneva, in Switzerland; Brussels, in Belgium; London, in England; and other settlements in southern Italy where there is an ArbÃ«reshÃ« community. In 2006, a statue of Skanderbeg was unveiled on the grounds of St. Paul's Albanian Catholic Community in Rochester Hills, Michigan. It is the first statue of Skanderbeg to be erected in the United States.[167]
